speaker: MAN
line: AAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!

speaker: FLIGHT ATT
line: Excuse me, Sir. Where is the passenger who was sitting here?

speaker: SEATMATE
line: He’s been gone since I woke up. I assumed he was in the restroom.

speaker: FLIGHT ATT
line: Please take your seat, Sir. We’re about to land. Sir, we’re landing any minute now. Sir? Sir?

speaker: FLIGHT ATT
line: AAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHH!!!!!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Come in. Thank you for getting here so quickly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s not much traffic at this hour.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, this is Dr. Simon Bruin. He’s with the Philadelphia office of the Centers for Disease Control.

speaker: BRUIN
line: A pleasure, Dr. Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How familiar are you with the series of kidnappings that have taken place in Philadelphia?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only what I’ve read in the Herald. Uh, that four young men have gone missing over the past three months --- all of them African-American.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A joint FBI-Philadelphia PD task force has been working around the clock ----- but there have been no leads to speak of... until last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened last night?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Owen Sanders, then man most recently reported missing, was found dead near a construction site.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How was he killed?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That’s just it, Agent Scully. He wasn’t. There was no evidence indicating homicide.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has a cause of death been determined.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. But I’ll let Dr. Bruin give you his thoughts on that.

speaker: BRUIN
line: This was taken last night less than an hour after Sanders’ body was found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m sorry, I thought you said that Owen Sanders was black.

speaker: BRUIN
line: He was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not sure I follow.

speaker: BRUIN
line: See for yourself. Owen Sanders was a perfectly normal young black man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assume you’re going somewhere with this.

speaker: BRUIN
line: The depigmentation we are seeing may actually be characteristic of a disease... an apparently fatal one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you don’t think these men are victims of a crime at all.

speaker: BRUIN
line: It’s my opinion, Dr. Scully, this investigation should begin and end under a microscope.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Bruin’s hope was that someone with a solid medical background like yourself could make a quick and decisive analysis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Case number 2139318537. Subject is a black male, 19 years in his skin, hair and eyes. The appearance of which suggests albinism, though the bleaching of the irises indicates a violent and unexplained cellular reaction to a vector or an environment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey. I heard you were down here slicing and dicing. Who’s the lucky stiff?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His name was Owen Sanders. He was reported as the fourth kidnap victim in Philadelphia until his body turned up last night looking like this.

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s a Michael Jackson joke in here somewhere, but I can’t quite find it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have been requested to determine what leeched the pigment from his body.

speaker: MULDER
line: Requested by whom?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Centers for Disease Control.

speaker: MULDER
line: The CDC in a kidnap case?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they believe that the uh, the case has been mislabeled. That this man and the others may have fallen prey to a disease or a pathogen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Based on what other evidence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There were no external signs of trauma or defense wounds and uh, his wallet was still full of cash.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s interesting. What, uh, what sort of disease is this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know. There are conditions like vitiligo which attack melanocytes and prevent the manufacture of melanin in the skin. Auto immune disorders which are not yet clearly understood.

speaker: MULDER
line: So this man died of a disorder. He and four other young black men who conveniently contracted the disease in succession and then disappeared without any explanation whatsoever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it’s very possible that they have already turned up but because of the depigmentation there may have been a problem with identification, so I have reissued descriptions of John Does to area morgues and ERs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, has it occurred to you that this might just be a...a little PR exercise?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m sorry?

speaker: MULDER
line: To divert attention from the fact that young black men are dying and nobody seems to be able to bring in a suspect? The perception being that nobody cares.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, not everything is a labyrinth of dark conspiracy, and not everybody is plotting to deceive, inveigle and obfuscate.

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: SCULLY
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you lift any forensic evidence from the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, there’s hair, skin, and fiber behind you on the counter. What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m going to join the snipe hunt.... if you don’t mind.... before the body count rises.

speaker: MAN
line: Mr. Aboah? Anyone home? Samuel Aboah?

speaker: ABOAH
line: Yes?

speaker: MAN
line: I’m Marcus Duff. Remember me? Your immigration counselor. We have an appointment to go over your naturalization petition.

speaker: ABOAH
line: Please.

speaker: DUFF
line: Thank you. We could, ah, use a little light in here to fill out the petition. Maybe you could open a window, or something.

speaker: DUFF
line: I guess that works. Have a seat, Samuel. This is a little complicated. So..... You okay? You look ill. You got a fever or something?

speaker: ABOAH
line: No.

speaker: DUFF
line: I know how lonely it is. Believe me..... being in a strange place far from your family. But once you become a US citizen I can help you bring over every brother, sister, aunt, uncle, and cousin. It all starts today, Samuel. Know what I’m saying?

speaker: ABOAH
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Pendrell. Thanks for turning this materials analysis around on such short notice.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Shouldn’t we wait for Agent Scully? Just so I won’t have to repeat myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s not coming.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: She had a date.

speaker: MULDER
line: Breathe, Agent Pendrell. It’s with a dead man. She’s doing an autopsy. You said you found something?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Yeah, asbestos fibers. Not much there. And I didn’t think there was much of anything either among the vegetable debris, all local soils, pollen, etc. ‘til I came across this. We had to go online with a botanist at UVN to determine what it was.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it looks like some kind of thorn.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: It’s a seed, actually. But nothing you’ll find at your local nursery. Adenia Volkensii.

speaker: MULDER
line: Help me out.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: It’s from a rare species of passionflower. It’s a rare night blooming plant indigenous to only certain parts of West Africa.

speaker: MULDER
line: How could something this small travel 5,000 miles around the world and wind up on Owen Sanders?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: That I couldn’t tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: It contains a cerebropathic glycoside. Does that mean anything to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If I’m correct, it’s a cortical depressant that works on the higher centers of the brain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it lethal?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In large enough quantities it might be. Larger than anything contained in a single seed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did the toxicology scan detect any of it in Owen Sanders’ blood?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, the tox screen was clean.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could his body have metabolized the substance?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only if the victim hadn’t expired immediately.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does that tell you anything about anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but.... I think I found something that could explain the depigmentation in the victim. His pituitary gland was necrotized.

speaker: MULDER
line: His pituitary gland?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The pituitary gland secretes all the regulatory hormones in the body and it controls the production of melanin in the skin cells.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you found evidence that this is a disease?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I have identified the effect. I am still looking for the cause.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, well why don’t you let me know as soon as you find anything out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Off to water the seeds of doubt. Bye-bye.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ms. Covarrubias?

speaker: MARITA
line: Who are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Mulder. Fox Mulder.

speaker: MARITA
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry I frightened you.

speaker: MARITA
line: What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not sure why, but I thought you might be in a position to help me.

speaker: MARITA

speaker: MULDER
line: Four young men are missing in Philadelphia. One of the men was found dead last night. This seed was recovered from the victim’s body. It’s from a rare species of plant found only in West Africa. Do you know anything about this case?

speaker: MARITA
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there any way you could find something out about it?

speaker: MARITA
line: Thousands of exotic species cross into US soil every day undetected. Bilge water is emptied into harbors. Produce sent through the mail. In practical terms, borders are little more than lines on maps.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that a yes or a no.

speaker: MARITA
line: I can’t help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can’t, or you won’t? You made an overture to me. You left an opening. Tell me I’m wrong. Tell me there’s nothing here and I’ll just walk away. Either way, I need to know.

speaker: DRIVER
line: Hey, I got a schedule. Are you getting on or not? What’s your problem? Are you on drugs, or something? Ah, the hell with you. You can walk for all I care. Damned drugs.

speaker: DRIVER
line: He was sitting right here staring up at me with these glassy eyes. Pretty much out of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean he looked sick?

speaker: DRIVER
line: Yeah, now that you mention it. I mean, I asked him if he needed help, but he didn’t say squat. Don’t forget to put down I had a schedule to keep.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: DRIVER

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have another missing young man. His name is Alfred Kittel. 17 years old. He’s African American. His mother called the police

speaker: MULDER
line: How does she know he’s missing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He works at a fast food place down the street. He takes this bus every night, and last night he never made it home. They found his knapsack on the bench here. Police are out canvassing. I talked to a bus driver who said that he seemed disoriented and non-responsive which seems to me like it might be some kind of pre-symptomatic dementia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or a reaction to a powerful cortical depressant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you suggesting?

speaker: MULDER
line: You find Alfred Kittel and you find another one of those weird African seeds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you so sure?

speaker: MULDER
line: Three months ago – one week before the first person was reported missing – the New York Port Authority filed that with the FAA. Like Owen Sanders, this man wasn’t an albino either. Not until he was found dead on a charter flight from West Africa, from Burkina Faso. The Embassy demanded that the body be returned before an autopsy could be performed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It says here that the cause of death was undetermined.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, undetermined, Scully, but not necessarily unknown.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Aboah? What the hell kind of name is that? Mr. Aboah?

speaker: ABOAH
line: Yes?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Philadelphia PD. We’re canvassing the building in regard to a missing person’s case. This is the young man we’re looking for. Have you seen him?

speaker: ABOAH
line: No.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Well, if you hear from anyone who has, or come across any information at all, you can reach us at this number. That’s a hotline. You can call 24 hours a day.

speaker: ABOAH
line: Thank you.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Thank you.

speaker: DUFF
line: I am really quite busy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m sorry. We won’t take up much of your time. The INS District Chief told us that you were in charge of most of the casework for aliens emigrating from Africa and the Caribbean.

speaker: DUFF
line: I assist people from that part of the world where I came from 15 years ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we’re looking for somebody that came a little more recently than that. On a flight from Burkina Faso? This is the passenger manifest from the charter company.

speaker: DUFF
line: And... you want me to do what exactly?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’d like you to cross reference those names on that list with anyone applying for permanent resident status or a work visa within the last three months.

speaker: DUFF
line: I am a social worker. Not a police officer. My business is not chasing down illegals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, we’re not here to arrest anybody.

speaker: DUFF
line: But you are FBI agents, are you not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Investigating a possible public health crisis.

speaker: DUFF
line: What kind of crisis?

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s not home. We might as well get comfortable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It has to be here, Mulder. There has to be some evidence of a virus or bacterium.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I think if you looked up from the microscope for a minute, you’d see that what’s really missing is a motive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The motive of any pathogen is to reproduce itself. And my job as a doctor is to find out if and how it is being transmitted.

speaker: MULDER
line: If this is a health crisis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Death is a health crisis. Something caused Owen Sanders’ pituitary to fail which in turn caused his metabolism to drop resulting in myaxadema coma and finally in death. Sometimes you have to start at the end to find the beginning. I just hope we don’t have to find another dead body to discover what that is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe we won’t have to wait. Mr. Aboah? Can I talk to you a minute?

speaker: MULDER
line: Boy, this guy can move.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s not here.

speaker: MULDER
line: He has to be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think I know where he went. Come on, Mulder. Let’s go. We’ve lost him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. Look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: From all outward signs, this man appears asymptomatic. I appreciate the connection you’ve tried to make, but I’m afraid it’s a dead end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With your permission, sir, I’d like to examine him some more. I’d like to run a suppression test, to do a TSH screen, take a history.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: It would help if we could talk to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m working on that.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: All right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not yet. But that doesn’t mean he isn’t a carrier or even the index case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he’s some kind of case the way he disappeared down that drain pipe.

speaker: DUFF
line: Why has Samuel Aboah been arrested? You said his health was in danger. Why have I been lied to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nobody has lied to you, sir.

speaker: DUFF
line: Then please, release him immediately.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We would like to do some more tests on him. We have to be certain that his health hasn’t been endangered and that he isn’t endangering others.

speaker: DUFF
line: Then why have you called me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As a translator. We’d like to be able to ask him some questions.

speaker: DUFF
line: About what?

speaker: MULDER
line: About Alfred Kittel and about several other young men who have gone missing since his arrival in Philadelphia three months ago.

speaker: DUFF
line: Then... this is about a criminal charge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are no charges against Mr. Aboah.

speaker: MULDER
line: We only arrested him because he ran when we tried to question him, and I want to know why he ran.

speaker: DUFF
line: Sir, if you had ever been beaten by the police or had your home burned to the ground for no other reason than being born then maybe you would understand why he ran and why you would run too.

speaker: MULDER
line: That man ran because he’s hiding something. And no amount of tests you run on him, no science is going to find that. Excuse me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: To find someone who I know plotted to deceive, inveigle and obfuscate.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Minister, this is Agent Mulder with the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you for seeing me at such a late hour, sir.

speaker: MINISTER
line: I did not have much of a choice in this matter. Someone from the United Nations spoke to the ambassador directly. What’s so important that it can’t wait?

speaker: MULDER
line: With all due respect, sir, I think you already know.

speaker: MINISTER
line: Do I?

speaker: MULDER
line: `Something happened on a flight from your country about three months ago --- something that you felt compelled to hide even from your own ambassador. The State Department said the request to stop investigating this man’s death came directly from you. Now, I understand the need to protect your diplomatic position, but more men are dying, sir.

speaker: MINISTER
line: Even if I tell you what I know, you would never believe it.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’d be surprised at what I believe, sir.

speaker: MINISTER
line: I had hoped if I closed my eyes it would go away this time?

speaker: MULDER
line: This time?

speaker: MINISTER
line: My people... the Bambara, are farmers. I grew up hearing the old stories, believing them as only a child can believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kinds of stories?

speaker: MINISTER
line: The Teliko...spirits.... of the air.

speaker: MINISTER
line: It was said they rested by day in close, dark places, deep inside tree hollows and in holes beneath the ground too small even for a child to hide himself.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Mr. Aboah?

speaker: MINISTER
line: Only when the sun fell, when the rest of the world was sleeping, would they come out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come out to do what, sir?

speaker: MINISTER
line: I was seven years old. Lying awake one night, I saw him. He was standing over me. His hair was like straw.... his eyes like water, staring down at me. I closed my eyes and screamed and felt myself being swept up into the air, but when I opened my eyes, I saw my father holding me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then, it was a nightmare.

speaker: MINISTER
line: That’s what my father said, and I believed him, until the next day... when they found my cousin, dead among his cattle, looking exactly like this man.

speaker: MINISTER
line: Which is why, when this photograph came across my desk three months ago --- I knew the Teliko was more than just a children’s story. I knew it was real. I knew he was here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This patient appears to have something in his throat, some kind of aberrant bone growth, or maybe something foreign lodged in his esophagus.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Could be a lot of things. You’d be amazed what I’ve seen removed from people’s throats in emergency rooms.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that’s only part of it. I discovered something even more disturbing when his PET series came back. Look right here on the sagittal section, right below the hypothalamus.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: There must be some mistake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s no mistake. This patient has no pituitary gland.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: But that’s not possible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can’t even begin to explain what we’re seeing here, sir. I just hope this patient can, can provide us with some of the answers.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’ll have to find him first.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was looking for you down in quarantine. Samuel Aboah’s gone. Disappeared.

speaker: DUFF
line: Samuel? You scared me. They let you out of the hospital?

speaker: ABOAH
line: Yes.

speaker: DUFF
line: Everything is fine? Samuel? Did you want to see me about something?

speaker: ABOAH
line: nan

speaker: DUFF
line: Well, come on. Let me give you a ride home. We can talk about it on the way. Lucky for you, I was working late.

speaker: ABOAH
line: Yes. Lucky.

speaker: DUFF
line: Come, let’s go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When did this happen?..... Thank you, Lieutenant. I appreciate it. Mulder.....

speaker: MULDER
line: I think this was his getaway vehicle. He didn’t even touch his Jell-O.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let’s go. That was the Philadelphia PD. Marcus Duff’s car turned up abandoned with the keys in the ignition and the hood still hot.

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: ...... requesting ambulance......

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know what happened to him?

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: I won’t even try to guess what happened to him, but he’s alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about Aboah? Any indication of where he might be?

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: We’re still sweeping the area. I’ll keep you posted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s got to be around here somewhere, Mulder. He can’t have gotten far.

speaker: MULDER
line: This guy can squeeze into a coffee can, Scully. He could be anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They’ll find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’ll find another victim.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: We interrupted him before he could finish.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Interrupted his killing Duff?

speaker: MULDER
line: The killing is just incidental I think, Scully, to a far more basic need.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What need?

speaker: MULDER
line: If Aboah has no pituitary then his body would lack the ability to produce melanin itself, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Theoretically, yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, when you examined him you didn’t observe one single albino trait or characteristic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Considering his PET scan results I don’t even know how he managed to stay alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s what I’m talking about, Scully, survival. And not just Aboah’s. I think that anomaly you observed is not just physiological, I think it may be evolutionary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: The lost tribe, a clan of sub-Saharan albinos linked by their common congenital deficit who’ve adapted over generations by....

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, by stealing other people’s hormones?

speaker: MULDER
line: Somehow, Aboah has managed to survive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, however he’s managed to survive wha --- I mean what.... what makes you think he’s not an isolated case?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because of something somebody told me last night. An African folktale.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you’re basing this theory on a folktale?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s just another way of describing the same truth, right? I mean all new truths begin as heresies and end as superstitions. We... we fear the unknown, so we reduce it to the terms that are most familiar to us, whether that’s a folktale, or a disease, or a...... conspiracy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, even if you’re right, I mean especially if you’re right, why would he leave his own country to come here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Free cable. I don’t know, the same reasons anybody comes to this country. Liberty, the freedom to pursue your own interests. Look at that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s a demolition site.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are we here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Pendrell found asbestos fibers on Owen Sanders’ body. And you remove asbestos from an old building before you tear it down. It had to come from somewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ow.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder? Mulder? Mulder? Mulder! Mulder, are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s okay, Mulder. I’m here, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry, Mulder. Yes, this is Dana Scully with the FBI requesting immediate EMS and police assistance. I’m in Liberty Plaza....... My badge number? JTT0331613.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Liberty Plaza. There’s a demolition site on the north side of the street.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Special Agent Dana Scully, Field Journal Entry number 74. Despite acute trauma to his pituitary gland, Marcus Duff was discharged early this morning from Mt. Zion Medical Center. He is expected to testify before a Grand Jury in the capital case against Samuel Aboah who is being charged with five counts of murder. It remains uncertain, however, whether Aboah will live long enough to stand trial. His response to hormone therapy has been poor, his deterioration progressive. My conviction remains intact that that the mechanism by which Aboah killed and in turn survived, can only be explained by medical science, and that science will eventually discover his place in the broader context of evolution. But what science may never be able to explain is our ineffable fear of the alien among us; a fear which often drives us not to search for understanding, but to deceive, inveigle, and obfuscate. To obscure the truth not only from others, but from ourselves.
